Public Opinion And Election Polling Market Definition And Segments

Public opinion is the culmination of the individual attitudes or ideas of a sizable portion of the population regarding a given topic or issue. Electoral polling is a method that uses election surveys to gather data based on the opinions of a sample of individuals.

The main survey types of public opinion and election polling are product surveys, website surveys, focus group surveys, conference feedback surveys, and others. A product survey is a series of questions sent to a specific segment of the user base to gather valuable user feedback about the state of the user experience. The various modes of surveys include online surveys, paper surveys, telephonic surveys, and one-to-one interviews, and are used for public opinion and election polling.

The public opinion and election polling market covered in this report is segmented â€“

1) By Mode: Online Surveys, Paper Surveys, Telephonic Surveys, One-to-One Interviews

2) By Survey Type: Product Survey, Website Survey, Focus Group Survey, Conference Feedback Survey, Other Survey Types

3) By Application: Public Opinion, Election Polling

The public opinion and election polling market size has grown steadily in recent years. It will grow from $8.18 billion in 2023 to $8.43 billion in 2024 at a compound annual growth rate (CAGR) of 3.1%. The growth in the historic period can be attributed to media influence and coverage, political events and campaigns, demographic shifts, social and economic factors, historical voting patterns.

The public opinion and election polling market size is expected to see steady growth in the next few years. It will grow to $9.55 billion in 2028 at a compound annual growth rate (CAGR) of 3.2%. The growth in the forecast period can be attributed to social media and digital platforms, polarization and political climate, issue-centric campaigns, demographic changes and diversity, evolving communication channels. Major trends in the forecast period include social media influence, globalization of polling practices, response rate challenges, public trust in polling, adaptation to societal changes.

Growing Demand For Public Opinion Drives The Public Opinion And Election Polling Market

The increasing requirement for public opinion is anticipated to drive the demand for public opinion and election polling markets. Public opinion and polls act as measuring tools to find out what people think about a particular product, person, activity, company, or any other area that is relevant to medical research and innovation. These polls help countries and companies decide on a new leader, release a product, make changes to the organizational structure of activities, or make other important strategic decisions. The requirement for public opinion for making decisions in government and business activities aids in the growth of the public opinion and election polling market.

Rising Internet And Social Media Usage Fuels Growth In Public Opinion And Election Polling Market

The increasing use of the internet and social media is expected to propel the growth of public opinion and the election polling market going forward. A social media platform is a communication platform that uses the internet. Social media has a profound impact on public opinion, as it is a powerful tool for reaching out to audiences and understanding their needs and desires. It is increasingly being used for election surveys, as it provides a platform for collecting data based on the opinions of a sample of individuals. For instance, in February 2023, according to Meltwater, a Netherlands-based software company, internet users in the UK increased by 224,000 (+0.3%) between 2022 and 2023. There were 66.11 million internet users in the UK overall. In addition, in the UK, there are 35 million LinkedIn members and 28.75 million Instagram users. Therefore, the increasing use of the internet and social media is driving the growth of public opinion and the election polling market.

False Polling Hinders The Market

Erroneous polling results are expected to hinder public opinion and the electoral polling market. This is due to a variety of factors, including sampling error, a low response rate, response bias (when respondents' answers do not reflect their true beliefs), coverage issues, and surveyor questions. The opinion of the public may change with time and other influences that result in a different outcome.

Innovative Partnerships Drive Advancements In Public Opinion And Election Polling

Innovations and the launch of new techniques through partnerships and collaborations are gaining popularity in the public opinion and election polling market. Major companies operating in the industry and government organizations are introducing new technologies to make surveys and voting more reliable, accessible, and genuine, including variability and eliminating errors. For instance, in July 2023, the Council of State Governments, a US-based non-profit organization, partnered with The Turnout, a US-based organization that organizes voter registration, to form the Election Technology Initiative (ETI). The ETI will promote and provide open-source solutions for election administrators to enhance the safety and transparency of U.S. and international elections as well as raise voter trust, accessibility, and participation. ElectionGuard, a piece of open-source software created by Microsoft's Democracy Forward Initiative, will be switched over to the ETI as the project's first step. Vendors of voting machines and election officials are given the tools they need by ElectionGuard to conduct audits after elections that are end-to-end verifiable.

Integration Of New Technologies Enhances Products In Public Opinion And Election Polling

Major companies operating in the public opinion and election polling market are focused on incorporating new technological solutions into their existing products to sustain their positions in the market. Incorporation of new technology refers to adding or integrating the latest technological advancements or innovations into products that a company already offers. This can involve enhancing the features, capabilities, or performance of existing products by integrating cutting-edge technology. For instance, in August 2021, Election Systems & Software, a US-based manufacturer of voting machine equipment and services, incorporated Microsoft Surface Go, a lightweight and portable laptop, into their ExpressPoll, an electronic poll book used in the voting process, to provide the security, portability, and usability poll workers need. The ES&S portfolio includes the well-known and successful product, ExpressPoll. And Surface Go is a crucial foundation for ExpressPoll, a product that has undergone extensive real-world field testing.

Accenture Acquires Anser Advisory To Enhance Infrastructure Project Success

In August 2023, Accenture PLC, an Ireland-based professional services company, acquired Anser Advisory for an undisclosed amount. This acquisition boosts Accenture's capacity to assist businesses and state and local public sector organizations in completing significant, long-term infrastructure projects more predictably and successfullyâ€”projects that support clients' growth and have a positive impact on communities. Anser Advisory LLC is a US-based public policy research and consulting firm that conducts public opinion and electoral polling.
